title: Odd Lore Question: Do Champions(or just Runeterrans in general) wear underwear?
body:
I'm fairly sure a bunch of the champions don't wear underwear. Let's ignore the non-humans, and just focus on the humans. 

I'm curious about whether they do or not.

replies.body: Jax goes commando.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-07-08T17:52:45.667+0000)
>
> Jax goes commando.

This information makes Jax's leap an even worse sight for the Champion on the receiving end, imagine Jax engages on you and all you see is an eggplant homing in at your face.

> [{quoted}](name=CarpeConundrum,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=00070003,timestamp=2019-07-09T01:19:27.643+0000)
>
> Can yall believe a red replied to this fucking joke thread but all the threads highlighting actual issues like bugs, broken client issues, and balance problems get zero red attention.
> 
> Fuck this company.

Read his title: He's a writer, and deal with the game lore and background stories - he got NOTHING to do with fixing ingame bugs or the client itself!

I have isues with the company too, but I DO NOT take it out on someone who is not involved.
Not their fault you think a Writer has any say in the game's state or balance, or that you think Rioters that have anything to do with those things hang out in Story, Art, & Sound.

> [{quoted}](name=CarpeConundrum,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0007000300000000,timestamp=2019-07-09T05:18:16.442+0000)

> How do you get the taste of Riot's shoe out of your mouth you boot-licking toadie.

I still don't attack people who aren't involved.

Can you believe a Rioter on the Narrative team replied to a post regarding lore, a post that actually pertains to their job? How fucking _dare_ they.

People like you are the reason why Rioters don't post here.

That being said, Odin is just doing his job. If you want to bother Rioters that have something to do with the game's balance or development, go hang out in Gameplay, because you're not going to find them here.

This particular Rioter is on the Writing team - Part of the story team.  AKA has nothing to do with what you're talking about, and everything to do with this thread. 

No need to be so hostile, you could always go play a different game.
Is this a lowkey confirmation that jax is a human?
Jax is not human

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-07-08T17:52:45.667+0000)

Hn.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-07-08T17:52:45.667+0000)
>
> Jax goes commando.

I do not get this expression.
he doesn't wear underwear

since ive asked before and never got an answer maybe you can help me. So rengar is a Kiilash. and he is also a runt which means he is smaller then them. despite this rengar is bigger then the average human. So what i need to know is how big are the Kiilash. more specifically how big is rengar Supposed to be
because he is the champ.

Hm...

Since no-one else is really giving an honest answer. 
{{champion:79}} 
Gragas wears underwear, or atleast whatever the rags may cover. On his model, it does cover up below him, thus counts as underwear.

{{champion:40}} 
Janna may or may not be wearing underwear. It's her "battle armor" but also a lingerie. 

{{champion:22}} 
Ashe also wears underwear, though blackened by the model; how close the shadowing is to her private areas can give away that these must be black panties.

{{champion:103}} {{champion:497}} {{champion:498}} 
Though cannot be confirmed by the model, lore wise they're wild beasts who can shapeshift. 
Xayah and Rakan, especially since they're rebelling against Ionia and other humans; wear nothing under there.
Ahri wished to become human, so it would make since for her to wear at least a thong.


{{champion:142}} 
Zoe isn't lying about her "I'ma dance in my super pants, otherwise I'd be naked." 
However this raises a question of itself.
Does she mean naked as in _bare_ naked, or just in underwear?
Whatever it may be, all we know is she's wearing shorts.

{{champion:134}} 
This, I can give an easy answer to.
YES, she's not wearing underwear. She's wearing "underarmor."
Same can be said for LeBlanc. They're both wearing lingerie under their armor, thus only protecting their good parts with the lingerie.

I've wasted 30 min answering this question in detail for you. Be grateful.

> [{quoted}](name=Paletongue,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-07-08T14:09:52.414+0000)
>

> [{quoted}](name=AFK Yuumi Main,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-07-08T10:48:24.112+0000)
>

>
> Though cannot be confirmed by the model, lore wise they're wild beasts who can shapeshift. 
> Xayah and Rakan, especially since they're rebelling against Ionia and other humans; wear nothing under there.

_[Also, Xayah needs room to lay any sudden eggs.](https://jolyday.com/img/luxofdemacia2059556931.jpg?)_

You're right about the shapeshifters - Nidalee also wears nothing under there, at least with certain skins. Leopard and Classic skin at least. 
Lepard Nidalee even got a litteral hole where...is it _exactly_ where I think it is? :O
_Not_ that _into the female anatomy...or at least that particular place_

_I tried loading in Zoe's model, but the browser froze and I got FBI on the door._ :'(

Piltovans, Zaunites, and Bilgewater residents certainly wear the undergarments of the 18th-19th centuries (especially corsets; they're essential for steampunk). Demacians and Noxians would likely wear them from a few centuries back, maybe 15th-17th centuries. Similarly for Ionia, but they would likely wear Asian-based undergarments. Don't ask me about Freljord, Ixtal, or Shurima, because I know next to nothing about the realities of Viking, Egyptian, and Mayan/Incan/Aztec clothing.

EDIT: Forgot to mention Buhru; since they're based on Polynesian cultures, they likely wouldn't wear much in the way of undergarments since they live in a pretty warm archipelago. And we know next to nothing about the culture of the Blessed Isles (but that might possibly change when that new marksman comes out?) so I won't even try to ask what they wore.

I think Bilgewater residents wearing 18th-19th century underwear is quite unlikely. For one they're in the same climate as the Buhru, but I also don't think Bilgewater is a posh underwear kind of place.

Most importantly though Miss Fortunes splash shows whatever underwear she is wearing is not bulky in any way. Since you can see the side of her thigh through the openings in her pants.

> [{quoted}](name=Mogarl,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-07-10T12:48:49.027+0000)
>
> I think Bilgewater residents wearing 18th-19th century underwear is quite unlikely. For one they're in the same climate as the Buhru, but I also don't think Bilgewater is a posh underwear kind of place.
> 
> Most importantly though Miss Fortunes splash shows whatever underwear she is wearing is not bulky in any way. Since you can see the side of her thigh through the openings in her pants.

More what pirates would have worn in the 18th century. And I mentioned Buhru separately, since most of the actual pirate culture in Bilgewater (and, to that extent, the Serpentine Delta) seems to have migrated from the lower ranks of society in Valoran, as have the people. They likely would try to keep their style of clothing and simply modify it for temperature as opposed to adopting Buhru clothing in an instant, as we can see from most non-Illaoi Bilgewater champions, similar to how Europeans tried to keep their styles when migrating to different climates and simply modified them for the heat.
{{champion:86}} wears two pairs of underwear.
go to the teemo.gg model viewer and check for yourself haha
Pantheon now has become great. :)

> [{quoted}](name=SuicidePlank,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-07-08T10:28:29.984+0000)
>
> Pantheon now has become great. :)

https://pm1.narvii.com/5778/4dbfe57eb5183e99f389887f920c3e356cb167a2_hq.jpg

Almost guaranteed they do. People have worn undergarments since at least the ancient egyptians. Warmer regions such as Shurima probably don't though, loincloths are enough for them to not roast their nuts.

Aatrox's current host was human at one point (so it counts dammit!), and he doesn't wear any underwear.

_Not saying that that's a bad thing, though..._

> [{quoted}](name=man of tin,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=ywEb2oXq,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-07-08T13:59:11.477+0000)
>
> Aatrox's current host was human at one point (so it counts dammit!), and he doesn't wear any underwear.
> 
> _Not saying that that's a bad thing, though..._

This reminds me of the halloween costume equality post on Tumblr.

Someone complained about how girl outfits are skimpy and they should be more equal to boys.

Someone else piped up that they'd prefer it to be equal but in reverse, they want to see boys in cat ears and underwear.

Forgive me for straying a bit from the point of this topic but, I'm personally not concerned about whether they do wear it or not, as much as i wonder what kind they could wear. i often find myself looking up some strange stuff about history. like how their underwears were designed? what type of material they used? how often they bath? how would they do it? would they take care of their teeth? what would they use to brush them? i wonder this sort of thing about all over the world in different times of history. so i end up wondering the same stuff about Fantasy worlds as well.

I don't think Teemo wears underwear. At least the "normal" Teemo. He has a lot of furr and it shouldn't feel comfortable to wear it alongside his pants.

But Little Devil Teemo (the Lords' true form) actually wears underwear. Also both Super Teemo and Beemo wears underwear outside the pants, and Astro Teemo has to wear specialized underpants.
Lux does, I read on TVTropes that she has panties with childish designs, supposedly Star Guardian has a star and Mystic form has a butterfly.  I can't confirm this though.
If you wear unddies maybe other people do too?
